member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement
member.summary: Represents an animated element with properties that can be interpolated over time.
member.remarks: The class provides a set of properties, such as position offsets, scaling factors, rotation, color, opacity, and a generic value, that can be animated using associated objects. Each property can be updated independently based on its animation state and interpolation logic.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.LerpDouble
member.summary: Reusable interpolators for different property types.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.LerpColor
member.summary: Reusable color interpolator for string-based colors.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the element, where 0.0 is fully transparent and 1.0 is fully opaque.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a generic value associated with the element, which can be used for various purposes.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.Update(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Updates the current state of the object by interpolating its properties based on the specified time.
member.remarks: This method updates the properties of the object, such as offsets, scale, rotation, color, opacity, and value, by interpolating their respective states if they are not yet completed. Each property is updated independently based on its associated state and interpolation function.
member.param: The current time used to evaluate the interpolation states.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.GetDiff(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement)
member.summary: Computes the differences between the current instance and a specified previous instance.
member.remarks: The method compares the following properties: OffsetX, OffsetY, ScaleX, ScaleY, Rotation, Color, Opacity, and Value. Only properties with differing values are included in the returned dictionary.
member.param: The previous instance to compare against. Cannot be null.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the properties that differ between the current instance and the instance. The keys represent the property names, and the values represent the current values of those properties. If no differences are found, an empty dictionary is returned.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.Clone
member.summary: Clones the current instance, creating a new instance with the same property values.
member.returns: Returns the cloned element.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement.ResetStates
member.summary: Resets all animation states to null, effectively stopping any ongoing animations for the element.

member.summary: Applies the specified start time to the current layout strategy, if one is defined.
member.remarks: This method delegates the operation to the if it is not null. Ensure that a layout strategy is set before calling this method to avoid no-op behavior.
member.param: The start time to apply, represented as a .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElementGroup.GetDiff(System.DateTime,System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue{FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.JsonAnimatedElement},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement})
member.summary: Computes the differences between the current state of animated elements and their previous state, and enqueues the changes as JSON-serializable objects for further processing.
member.remarks: This method processes animated elements in parallel to compute their differences. If an element has changes compared to its previous state, the differences are added to the queue as a object. The method also updates the dictionary with the current state of the modified elements.
member.param: The current timestamp used to update the state of each animated element.
A thread-safe queue to which the computed differences are enqueued as objects.
A dictionary containing the previous state of animated elements, keyed by their unique identifiers. This dictionary is updated with the current state of elements that have changes.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimationState`1
member.summary: Represents a set of animation states, including start and end values, duration, easing functions, and interpolation logic.
member.remarks: This class is designed to facilitate animations by defining the start and end values, the duration of the animation, and the easing function and mode used to interpolate between the values. The method calculates the interpolated value at a specific point in time based on these parameters.
member.typeparam: The type of the values being interpolated. This type must support the interpolation strategy defined by the provided interpolator.

member.summary: Calculates the interpolated value at a specified point in time based on the elapsed duration, easing function, and interpolation strategy.
member.remarks: The interpolation progress is determined by the elapsed time since the start time, relative to the total duration. The progress is then adjusted using the specified easing function and mode before being passed to the interpolator.
member.param: The current time used to calculate the interpolation progress.
An object that defines the interpolation strategy for transitioning between the start and end values.
member.returns: The interpolated value of type at the specified time.

member.exception: Thrown if the specified combination of and is not supported.

member.summary: Provides easing functions that implement a "back" motion, where the animation overshoots its target and then returns to it. These functions are commonly used in animations to create a spring-like effect.

member.summary: Calculates the eased-in interpolation of a value using a back easing function.
member.param: The current time or position, where 0 represents the start and represents the end.
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
The overshoot amount, which controls the extent of the "back" effect. Defaults to 1.70158.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.BackEasing.EaseOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an "ease-out" interpolation to calculate a value based on the specified parameters.
member.remarks: This method implements a "back" easing function with an ease-out behavior, where the interpolation starts quickly and decelerates toward the end. The optional parameter allows customization of the overshoot effect, with higher values producing a more pronounced overshoot.
member.param: The current time or position, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
An optional overshoot parameter that controls the intensity of the easing effect. Defaults to 1.70158.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.summary: Applies an easing function that combines both "ease-in" and "ease-out" effects to calculate an interpolated value.
member.remarks: This method uses a combination of "ease-in" and "ease-out" easing, making it suitable for animations that require a smooth acceleration at the start and deceleration at the end. The optional parameter allows customization of the overshoot effect, where higher values result in a more pronounced easing curve.
member.param: The current time or position in the animation, where 0 represents the start and represents the end.
The starting value of the property being animated.
The total change in the value of the property being animated.
The total duration of the animation.
An optional overshoot parameter that controls the intensity of the easing effect. Defaults to 1.70158.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.BounceEasing
member.summary: Provides easing functions that simulate a bouncing motion for animations.
member.remarks:
This class includes static methods for calculating bounce easing values, which are commonly used in animations to create effects that mimic the behavior of a bouncing object. The easing functions include:
EaseOut: Starts quickly and decelerates, simulating a bounce at the end.
EaseIn: Starts slowly and accelerates, simulating a bounce at the beginning.
EaseInOut: Combines the effects of EaseIn and EaseOut, simulating a bounce at both the beginning and end. These methods are useful for creating visually appealing animations in user interfaces, games, or other graphical applications.

member.summary: Applies an easing-out function to interpolate a value over time, creating a decelerating motion.
member.remarks: This method uses a piecewise easing-out function based on the "bounce" easing equation. It is commonly used in animations to create a natural deceleration effect.
member.param: The current time, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.remarks: Circular easing functions create smooth transitions that mimic the motion of an object following a circular path. These functions are commonly used in animations to achieve natural-looking acceleration and deceleration effects.

member.summary: Represents a "circular" easing function, which creates an animation that follows a circular path.

member.summary: Represents a "cubic" easing function, which creates an animation that accelerates and decelerates in a cubic manner.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ElasticEasing
member.summary: Provides easing functions that produce an elastic motion effect, commonly used in animations.
member.remarks:
Elastic easing functions create a motion effect that resembles a spring oscillating back and forth before settling. These functions are useful for creating dynamic and visually appealing animations. The class includes three easing modes:
EaseIn Starts the motion slowly, then accelerates with an elastic effect.
EaseOut Starts the motion quickly, then decelerates with an elastic effect.
EaseInOut Combines the effects of EaseIn and EaseOut, starting and ending with an elastic effect.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ElasticEasing.m
member.summary: Represents a constant multiplier used in calculations.
member.remarks: The value is derived from multiplying 0.3 by 1.5.

member.summary: Calculates the eased-in value for a given time, using an elastic easing function.
member.remarks: This method uses an elastic easing function, which produces an oscillating effect that gradually decreases in amplitude as the animation progresses.

The starting value of the property being animated.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExponentialEasing
member.summary: Provides methods for performing exponential easing calculations, commonly used in animations to create smooth transitions between values.
member.remarks:
Exponential easing functions are used to interpolate values over time, producing transitions that start or end with a rapid change in value. These methods are useful in scenarios such as animating UI elements or simulating motion effects. The class includes three easing modes:
EaseIn Starts the transition slowly and accelerates towards the end.
EaseOut Starts the transition quickly and decelerates towards the end.
EaseInOut Combines EaseIn and EaseOut, starting and ending slowly with acceleration in the middle.

member.remarks: This method uses an exponential easing function, which starts slowly and accelerates as time progresses. If is 0, the method returns .

The starting value of the property being eased.
The total change in the value of the property being eased.
The total duration of the easing, in the same units as .
member.returns: The calculated eased-in value at the specified time .

member.summary: Applies an exponential easing-out function to interpolate a value over time.
member.remarks: This method implements an exponential easing-out function, which starts quickly and decelerates toward the end of the duration. If equals , the method returns + .

The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExponentialEasing.EaseInOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates an eased value using an exponential easing function with both "ease-in" and "ease-out" behavior.
member.remarks: This method applies an exponential easing function that accelerates at the beginning ("ease-in") and decelerates at the end ("ease-out"). The easing effect is symmetric, with the midpoint of the animation being the transition between acceleration and deceleration.
member.param: The current time or position within the animation, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the property being animated.
The total change in the value of the property being animated.
The total duration of the animation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuadraticEasing.EaseOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an ease-out interpolation to calculate a value based on the specified parameters.
member.remarks: The ease-out interpolation starts quickly and decelerates toward the end of the duration. Ensure that is not zero to avoid division by zero errors.
member.param: The current time or position, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuadraticEasing.EaseInOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an ease-in-out quadratic interpolation to calculate a value based on the progression of time.
member.remarks: This method uses a quadratic easing function to smoothly transition between the starting and ending values. The easing effect accelerates at the beginning, decelerates in the middle, and accelerates again toward the end.
member.param: The current time or position within the duration, where 0 represents the start and represents the end.
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the specified time .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuarticEasing
member.summary: Provides quartic easing functions for animations, which calculate intermediate values based on a quartic polynomial. These functions are commonly used to create smooth transitions in animations.
member.remarks:
The class includes three easing functions:
EaseIn Starts the motion slowly and accelerates as it progresses.
EaseOut Starts the motion quickly and decelerates as it progresses.
EaseInOut Combines the behaviors of EaseIn and EaseOut, starting and ending slowly while accelerating in the middle. Each function takes the same parameters, representing the current time, start value, change in value, and duration of the animation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuarticEasing.EaseIn(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the eased-in value for a given time using a quartic easing function.
member.remarks: This method applies a quartic easing-in function, which starts the motion slowly and accelerates as time progresses. It is commonly used in animations to create a smooth, natural-looking transition.
member.param: The current time, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the easing operation. Must be greater than 0.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the specified time .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuarticEasing.EaseOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an ease-out cubic interpolation to calculate a value based on the progression of time.
member.param: The current time or position in the interpolation, where 0 represents the start and represents the end.
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration of the interpolation.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuarticEasing.EaseInOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates an eased value using an ease-in-out quartic interpolation.
member.remarks: This method applies an ease-in-out quartic easing function, which accelerates at the beginning and decelerates at the end. The input is normalized relative to to calculate the eased value.
member.param: The current time or position within the interpolation, where 0 represents the start and represents the end.
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration of the interpolation.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the specified time .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuinticEasing
member.summary: Provides easing functions based on a quintic polynomial (t^5) for smooth animations.
member.remarks: Quintic easing functions are commonly used in animations to create smooth transitions. These functions calculate intermediate values based on a time parameter, allowing for different easing effects such as accelerating, decelerating, or a combination of both.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuinticEasing.EaseIn(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the eased value for a given time using an "EaseIn" quintic easing function.
member.param: The current time, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the property being eased.
The total change in the value of the property being eased.
The total duration of the easing operation.
member.returns: The calculated eased value at the specified time.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuinticEasing.EaseOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an easing-out function to interpolate a value over time, creating a decelerating motion.
member.param: The current time, in the range [0, ].
The starting value of the interpolation.
The total change in value over the duration.
The total duration of the interpolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.QuinticEasing.EaseInOut(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies an ease-in-out quintic interpolation to the given time value.
member.remarks: This method uses a quintic easing function to create a smooth transition that accelerates at the start, decelerates at the end, and maintains a steady rate in the middle.
member.param: The current time, or position, within the animation. Must be between 0 and .
The starting value of the property being animated.
The total change in the value of the property being animated.
The total duration of the animation.
member.returns: The interpolated value at the given time .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.CascadeLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a cascading pattern, applying incremental offsets to each element based on its position in the sequence.
member.remarks: The class is designed to animate elements by applying horizontal and vertical offsets that increase proportionally with the element's index. This layout is useful for creating visually appealing staggered animations or cascading effects.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.CascadeLayout.OffsetXStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal offset step applied to each subsequent element.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.CascadeLayout.OffsetYStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical offset step applied to each subsequent element.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ChaosLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that applies randomized transformations to animated elements, creating a chaotic and dynamic visual effect.
member.remarks: The class randomizes the position, rotation, scale, and opacity of animated elements within a specified spread range. This layout is useful for creating visually dynamic and unpredictable animations. The randomness is applied independently to each element, ensuring unique transformations for each. The property determines the range within which the random offsets for position are calculated. The layout also applies random rotation (0 to 360 degrees), scaling (between 0.5 and 1.5), and opacity (between 0.5 and 1.0) to each element.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ChaosLayout.Spread
member.summary: Gets or sets the spread value, which represents the difference between two related quantities.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FanLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a fan-like pattern, with configurable radius and angle spread.
member.remarks: The positions elements in a circular arc, where the radius determines the distance from the center and the angle spread defines the total angular range covered by the elements. The layout animates the position and rotation of each element based on the specified animation parameters.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FanLayout.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the fan layout, determining how far elements are positioned from the center.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FanLayout.AngleSpread
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle spread of the fan layout in degrees, defining the total angular range covered by the elements.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FloatLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout where elements float freely without a specific arrangement.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FloatLayout.DriftRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowable range of drift.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FlowerLayout
member.summary: Arranges elements in a circular layout resembling the petals of a flower.
member.remarks: The layout positions elements in a circular pattern, with each element placed at an equal angular distance from its neighbors. The radius of the circle is determined as one-third of the smaller dimension of the layout's width or height. The layout also applies a rotation to each element corresponding to its angular position.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GalaxyLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a spiral pattern resembling a galaxy, with configurable arms, spread, rotation, and number of turns.
member.remarks: This layout animates the position and rotation of elements to create a dynamic galaxy-like effect. The layout is defined by several parameters, including the number of arms, the spread of the elements, the rotation per turn, and the total number of turns. The animation is applied to each element's position and rotation over time.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GalaxyLayout.Arms
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of arms in the galaxy layout.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GalaxyLayout.Spread
member.summary: Gets or sets the spread factor of the galaxy layout, determining how far elements are spread out from the center.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GalaxyLayout.RotationPerTurn
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation in degrees for each complete turn of the spiral.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GalaxyLayout.Turns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of turns in the galaxy layout.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GoldenSpiralLayout
member.summary: Provides a layout strategy that arranges elements in a golden spiral pattern.
member.remarks: The golden spiral layout is based on the mathematical constant Phi (approximately 1.618), which defines the proportions of the spiral. Elements are positioned in a spiral pattern radiating outward from the center of the layout area. The layout animates the position and rotation of elements over a specified duration.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GoldenSpiralLayout.Phi
member.summary: Represents the mathematical constant Phi (), also known as the golden ratio.
member.remarks: The value of Phi is approximately 1.61803398875. It is an irrational number that appears in various fields such as mathematics, art, architecture, and nature.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GoldenSpiralLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The default duration for the layout animation is set to 2.5 seconds.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GridLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a grid with a fixed number of columns and uniform cell dimensions.
member.remarks: The class organizes elements into rows and columns based on the specified number of columns and the dimensions of each cell. The layout automatically calculates the position of each element within the grid and animates their transitions when the layout changes. This layout is particularly useful for scenarios where elements need to be displayed in a structured grid format, such as image galleries, dashboards, or data visualizations.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GridLayout.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid. Must be at least 1.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GridLayout.CellWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of each cell in the grid.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GridLayout.CellHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of each cell in the grid.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.HeartLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in the shape of a heart.
member.remarks: The class positions elements in a heart-shaped pattern, with their positions animated over time. The layout dynamically calculates the position of each element based on its index and the total number of elements, ensuring that all elements are evenly distributed along the heart curve. This layout is particularly useful for visually appealing animations or decorative UI elements. The animation parameters, such as duration and easing functions, are inherited from the base class .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.HelixLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a helical pattern, with each element positioned at an increasing angle and distance from the center.
member.remarks: The class calculates the position and rotation of elements based on their index in the sequence. Elements are arranged in a spiral-like structure, with their offsets and rotations animated over time. The layout is centered within the available width and height of the container. This layout is particularly useful for creating visually dynamic animations or effects where elements appear to follow a helical path.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.HelixLayout.AngleStep
member.summary: Represents the fixed angle increment, in degrees, used for calculations or operations that require discrete angular steps.
member.remarks: This constant defines the step size for angles, measured in degrees, and is intended for use in scenarios where angular values are processed in fixed increments, such as in geometric calculations or graphical rendering.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.HelixLayout.Spacing
member.summary: Represents the default spacing value used for layout calculations.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.HelixLayout.AngleIncrement
member.summary: Represents the constant angle increment in radians, calculated as the product of the angle step and the radians conversion factor.
member.remarks: This value is used to determine the incremental change in angle for operations requiring angular calculations in radians.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MagnetLayout

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MorphingLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout strategy that enables smooth transitions between multiple animated layouts.
member.remarks: The class is used to manage and animate transitions between different layouts of elements. It supports defining multiple layouts and morphing between them using specified animation parameters such as duration, easing function, and easing mode. This class is typically used in scenarios where dynamic and visually appealing layout transitions are required, such as in UI animations or data visualization. The layout transitions are controlled by the parent animation context, and the class provides methods to apply layouts, set dimensions, and manage the sequence of layouts. It also ensures proper disposal of resources when no longer needed.

member.remarks: Use this layout to create smooth fade-in and fade-out transitions for child elements during layout changes. The animation is typically triggered when elements are added, removed, or repositioned within the layout.

member.remarks: The layout positions elements in a spiral formation, with their positions determined by the specified and their index in the sequence. The animation includes transitions for the X and Y offsets as well as rotation, creating a dynamic spiral effect.

member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a spiral pattern, where each element's position is determined by its index, a step radius, and a step angle.
member.remarks: The layout calculates the position of each element based on polar coordinates, converting them to Cartesian coordinates. The distance between elements is controlled by , and the angular spacing is controlled by . The layout also supports animating the position and rotation of elements.

member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a stacked formation, applying a rotational transformation to each element.
member.remarks: This layout is typically used to create visually dynamic arrangements where elements are stacked on top of each other with a rotational offset. It is suitable for scenarios such as card stacks, carousel-like displays, or layered visual effects.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.StackLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges its child elements in a stack, either horizontally or vertically, with optional spacing between elements.
member.remarks: The is a specialized layout that positions its child elements sequentially in a single line, determined by the property. The spacing between elements can be customized using the property. This layout supports animations for transitioning child elements to their new positions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing value used to define the distance between elements.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SunburstLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a sunburst pattern, where elements are positioned radially around a central point with animated transitions.
member.remarks: The calculates the position of each element based on its index, distributing elements evenly around a circle. The layout supports animated transitions for smooth movement of elements to their calculated positions. The radius of each element's position increases incrementally, creating a layered, concentric effect. This layout is particularly useful for visualizations or UI components that require a radial arrangement of elements, such as charts or menus.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.VortexLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a dynamic spiral pattern, with optional rotation effects.
member.remarks: The arranges elements in a spiral configuration, where the spacing between elements is determined by and . The layout also supports dynamic rotation effects based on the elapsed time, controlled by the property. This layout is particularly useful for creating visually engaging animations or effects where elements follow a vortex-like motion.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.WaveLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout that arranges elements in a wave-like pattern, where the vertical position of each element is determined by a sine function based on its horizontal position.
member.remarks: The layout calculates the position of each element using the specified amplitude, frequency, and spacing. The horizontal position is determined by the index of the element multiplied by the spacing, while the vertical position is calculated as the sine of the horizontal position scaled by the amplitude and frequency. This layout is animated, and the positions of the elements are updated over time using the specified animation parameters.

member.summary: Represents a reference to a .NET object of type that can be passed to JavaScript interop.
member.remarks: This field is used to enable JavaScript to invoke methods on the associated instance. It is a readonly field and should be initialized with a valid instance.

member.summary: Represents a reference to a JavaScript module that can be used for invoking JavaScript functions.
member.remarks: This field holds an instance of that represents a JavaScript module. It is nullable, indicating that the module may not be initialized. Ensure the module is initialized before attempting to use it.

member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when the chapter changes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript runtime instance used for invoking JavaScript functions from .NET.

member.summary: Gets the progression percentage of the current time relative to the duration.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.OnResizeAsync
member.summary: Invoked by JavaScript to handle resize events and update the component's state accordingly.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be called from JavaScript via the with the identifier "onResize". It triggers an asynchronous operation to measure the width of the component and update its state.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.MeasureWidthAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously measures the width of the container associated with the current instance.
member.remarks: This method invokes a JavaScript function to retrieve the width of the container element identified by the Id property. Ensure that the JavaScript module is properly initialized before calling this method.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.StartDragAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs)
member.summary: Initiates a drag operation based on the specified pointer event.
member.remarks: This method sets the internal dragging state and triggers the event if it has subscribers. It also updates the seek position based on the pointer's client X-coordinate.
member.param: The pointer event arguments containing details about the pointer event, such as the client X-coordinate.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.OnDragAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the drag event and updates the seek position based on the pointer's horizontal position.
member.param: The pointer event arguments containing information about the drag event, including the pointer's position.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.EndDragAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs)
member.summary: Ends the drag operation and triggers the seek end event if applicable.
member.remarks: This method is called to finalize a drag operation. If the drag operation was active, it stops the drag, hides the preview, and invokes the event with the current time value.
member.param: The pointer event arguments associated with the drag operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.StartTouchAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs)
member.summary: Initiates the touch interaction for seeking functionality.
member.remarks: This method sets the dragging state to active and triggers the seek start event with the current time. It then updates the seek position based on the horizontal client coordinate of the first touch point.
member.param: The touch event arguments containing details about the touch interaction. The first touch point is used to determine the starting position.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.OnTouchMoveAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the touch move event and updates the seek position based on the touch's client X-coordinate.
member.remarks: This method is invoked during a touch move gesture when dragging is active. It processes the first touch point and updates the seek position accordingly. Ensure that dragging is enabled before invoking this method.
member.param: The touch event arguments containing information about the touch gesture.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.EndTouchAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs)
member.summary: Ends the current touch interaction, finalizing any ongoing drag operation.
member.remarks: This method is typically called when a touch interaction is completed. If a drag operation was in progress, it stops the drag and hides the preview. Additionally, it triggers the event with the current time value.
member.param: The containing details about the touch event.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.OnKeyDownAsync(Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentKeyCodeEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles key press events to perform seek operations in a media playback context.
member.remarks:
This method processes specific key inputs to adjust the playback position:
seeks backward by a predefined step.
seeks forward by a predefined step.
seeks to the beginning of the media.
seeks to the end of the media.
member.param: The key event arguments containing information about the key pressed.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.UpdateSeekAsync(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the seek position of the media playback based on the specified horizontal offset.
member.remarks: The method calculates the seek position as a percentage of the total duration based on the provided offset and the width of the container. The seek operation is performed asynchronously and may include a preview of the media at the calculated position.
member.param: The horizontal offset, in pixels, used to calculate the new seek position. Must be a value between 0 and the width of the container.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.UpdateSeekFromClientXAsync(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the seek position based on the specified client X-coordinate.
member.remarks: This method calculates the offset relative to the seek bar using the provided client X-coordinate and updates the seek position accordingly. If the module is not initialized, the method exits without performing any action.
member.param: The X-coordinate, in pixels, from the client that determines the seek position.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.SeekToAsync(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Seeks to the specified time within the media and optionally enables preview mode.
member.remarks: This method updates the current playback time and triggers the event if it has subscribers. If the seek operation results in a chapter change, the event is also triggered.
member.param: The target time, in seconds, to seek to. The value is clamped between 0 and the total duration of the media.
A boolean value indicating whether to enable preview mode. If , the preview state is updated without committing the seek operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.HidePreviewAfterDelayAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Hides the preview after a delay of 2 seconds.
member.remarks: If the operation is canceled via the provided , the preview will not be hidden.
member.param: A that can be used to cancel the delay operation.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.OnClickSeek(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the click event on the seek bar and updates the seek position based on the mouse click location.
member.remarks: This method does not perform any action if a drag operation is currently in progress.
member.param: The containing information about the mouse click event, including the client X-coordinate.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.GetChapterColor(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ChapterStatus)
member.summary: Determines the color representation for a chapter based on its status.
member.param: The status of the chapter. Must be one of the enumeration values.
member.returns: A CSS linear-gradient string representing the color associated with the specified chapter status. Returns "gray" if the status is not recognized.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SeekBar.FormatTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Formats a time value in seconds into a string representation in the format "mm:ss".
member.param: Number of elapsed seconds.
member.returns: Returns the formatted value.

member.remarks: This instance can be used to look up MIME types for file extensions. It is initialized with default mappings provided by the framework.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AudioMetadataProvider.GetFromFileAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile)
member.summary: Asynchronously retrieves audio metadata from the specified file.
member.remarks: This method reads the file's content into memory and extracts metadata from the stream. Ensure the file size is within the limits supported by the application to avoid memory issues.
member.param: The file to extract audio metadata from. Must not be null.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the extracted if the operation is successful; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AudioMetadataProvider.GetFromStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Extracts audio metadata from a given stream.
member.remarks: This method uses the TagLib library to parse the audio file and extract metadata. The extracted metadata includes information such as title, album, artists, duration, bitrate, and cover art. If the audio file is corrupt or in an unsupported format, the method logs the error and returns an empty object.
member.param: The name of the audio file, used for logging and identification purposes.
The input stream containing the audio file data. The stream must be readable and seekable.
member.returns: An object containing descriptive, technical, extended, legal, and visual metadata extracted from the audio file. Returns an empty object if the file is corrupt, unsupported, or an error occurs during processing.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AudioMetadataProvider.GetFromUrlAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves audio metadata from a specified URL.
member.remarks: This method downloads the audio file from the specified URL, processes it in memory, and extracts its metadata. Ensure that the URL points to a valid audio file.
member.param: The name to associate with the audio metadata.
The URL of the audio file. Can be if no URL is provided.
member.returns: An object containing the metadata of the audio file, or if the metadata could not be retrieved.

member.summary: Represents descriptive metadata for a musical track, including details such as title, album, performers, and other related information.
member.remarks: This class provides a structured way to store and access metadata commonly associated with musical tracks. It includes properties for identifying the track's title, album, contributors, genres, and other descriptive details. All string array properties are initialized as empty arrays to ensure safe iteration.

member.summary: Defines methods for retrieving audio metadata from various sources, such as URLs or uploaded files.
member.remarks: This interface provides asynchronous methods to extract metadata from audio files, including details such as title, artist, album, and duration. Implementations may support different audio formats and sources.

member.remarks: This method performs an asynchronous operation to fetch and parse metadata from the provided URL. Ensure the URL points to a valid and accessible audio file.
member.param: The URL of the audio file to retrieve metadata from. Can be null or empty, in which case the method will return .
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains an object with the metadata of the audio file, or if the metadata could not be retrieved.

member.remarks: The caller is responsible for ensuring the stream remains open and readable during the operation. The method does not modify the position of the stream.

member.summary: Represents a chapter within a media file, defined by its start and end times, title, and status.
member.remarks: This record is commonly used to represent segments of a media file, such as chapters in an audiobook or scenes in a video. The and properties define the time range of the chapter, while the provides a descriptive name. The indicates the current state of the chapter, such as whether it is active or inactive.
member.param: The start time of the chapter, in seconds. Must be greater than or equal to 0.
The end time of the chapter, in seconds. Must be greater than .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxColorPalette
member.summary: Represents a customizable color palette component that supports various color generation modes, gradient strategies, and selection options.
member.remarks: This component allows users to generate and interact with a color palette using predefined modes, gradients, or custom plugins. It supports single and multi-selection of colors, as well as advanced customization options such as grid layout, item size, and maximum color limits. The palette can also be populated from an image or preset configurations.

member.summary: Generates a list of color variations based on the specified base color.
member.param: The base color from which variations will be generated. Must be a valid color string (e.g., a hex code or color name).
The number of variations to generate. Must be a positive integer.
An object specifying additional options for color generation, such as brightness or saturation adjustments.
member.returns: A list of strings representing the generated color variations. The list will contain exactly items.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AccessibilitySafePlugin
member.summary: Returns a predefined set of colors that are designed to be accessible and distinguishable.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AccessibilitySafePlugin._safeColors
member.summary: Represents a set of colors that are designed to be accessible and distinguishable.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnalogousPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates analogous color palettes based on a base color.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ComplementaryPlugin
member.summary: Provides functionality to generate a complementary color gradient based on a specified base color.
member.remarks: This plugin calculates the complementary color of the given base color and generates a gradient using the complementary color as the starting point. The gradient is created based on the specified number of steps and generation options.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.CoolPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a gradient of colors based on a specified base color and options.
member.remarks: This plugin is designed to generate a gradient starting from a predefined base color of blue. The gradient generation process can be customized using the specified number of steps and additional options.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.DesaturatePlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that desaturates a base color by reducing its saturation level.
member.remarks: The desaturation amount is specified as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 leaves the color unchanged and 1 completely removes saturation, resulting in a grayscale color. This plugin generates a gradient of desaturated colors based on the specified number of steps and generation options.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.DesaturatePlugin.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Represents a plugin that desaturates a base color by reducing its saturation level.
member.remarks: The desaturation amount is specified as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 leaves the color unchanged and 1 completely removes saturation, resulting in a grayscale color. This plugin generates a gradient of desaturated colors based on the specified number of steps and generation options.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.DualHuePlugin
member.summary: Represents a color plugin that generates a gradient between two hues.
member.remarks: This plugin creates a gradient by blending a base color with a secondary color. The secondary color is specified during the initialization of the plugin.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.DualHuePlugin.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Represents a color plugin that generates a gradient between two hues.
member.remarks: This plugin creates a gradient by blending a base color with a secondary color. The secondary color is specified during the initialization of the plugin.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GrayscalePlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a series of greyscale colors.
member.remarks: This plugin implements the interface and generates greyscale colors by varying the lightness component while keeping hue and saturation fixed at zero.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MonochromaticPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a monochromatic color palette based on a given base color.
member.remarks: This plugin creates a gradient of colors with a constant hue, varying only in saturation and lightness. It is useful for generating visually cohesive color schemes where all colors share the same hue.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.NeonPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a sequence of neon-like colors based on a specified base color.
member.remarks: This plugin implements the interface and generates colors by varying the hue of the base color across the HSL color space. The resulting colors are designed to have maximum saturation and a fixed lightness, creating a vibrant neon effect.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.PastelPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a pastel color gradient based on a specified base color.
member.remarks: This plugin adjusts the saturation and lightness of the base color to create a pastel effect and generates a gradient using a hue-shifting strategy.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SplitComplementaryPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates color palettes based on the split-complementary color scheme.
member.remarks: The split-complementary color scheme is a variation of the complementary color scheme. It uses a base color and two colors adjacent to the base color's complement on the color wheel. This plugin generates gradients for each of the three colors in the scheme, combining them into a single palette.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.TetradicPlugin
member.summary: Generates a tetradic color scheme based on the specified base color, number of steps, and generation options.
member.remarks: A tetradic color scheme consists of four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel (90 apart). This method generates gradients for each of the four colors, distributing the specified number of steps across the gradients. The resulting list contains all generated colors in sequence.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.TriadicPlugin
member.summary: Generates a triadic color palette based on the specified base color.
member.remarks: A triadic color scheme is created by selecting three colors that are evenly spaced around the color wheel (120 degrees apart in hue). This method generates gradients for each of the three colors and combines them into a single palette.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.WarmPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plugin that generates a gradient of warm colors.
member.remarks: This plugin generates a gradient transitioning from red to gold. It can be used to create warm color palettes for various applications, such as UI design or data visualization.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.None
member.summary: No cursor is specified.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Auto
member.summary: Cursor is set automatically based on context.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Default
member.summary: Cursor is the default arrow cursor.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.ContextMenu
member.summary: Cursor indicates a context menu is available, typically a pointer with a small menu icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Help
member.summary: Cursor indicates help is available, typically a question mark or a pointer with a question mark.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Pointer
member.summary: Cursor indicates a clickable item, typically a hand icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Progress
member.summary: Cursor indicates a progress action is occurring, typically a pointer with a spinning circle or hourglass.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Wait
member.summary: Cursor indicates that the user should wait, typically an hourglass or spinning circle.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Cell
member.summary: Cursor indicates a cell selection, typically a plus sign.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Crosshair
member.summary: Cursor indicates crosshair selection, typically a crosshair icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Text
member.summary: Cursor indicates text selection, typically an I-beam icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.VerticalText
member.summary: Cursor indicates vertical text selection, typically an horizontal I-beam icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Alias
member.summary: Cursor indicates an alias action, typically a pointer with a small arrow.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Copy
member.summary: Cursor indicates a copy action, typically a pointer with a small plus sign.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Move
member.summary: Cursor indicates a move action, typically a pointer with four arrows.

member.summary: Cursor indicates no drop action, typically a circle with a line through it.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.NotAllowed
member.summary: Cursor indicates that an action is not allowed, typically a circle with a line through it.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Grab
member.summary: Cursor indicates grabbing action, typically a hand icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.Grabbing
member.summary: Cursor indicates grabbing action, typically a closed hand icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.AllScroll
member.summary: Cursor indicates all-direction scrolling, typically a four-arrow icon.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Cursor.ColResize
member.summary: Cursor indicates column resizing, typically a horizontal double arrow.

member.summary: Cursor indicates row resizing, typically a vertical double arrow.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AccountLabels
member.summary: Represents a set of localized labels and display texts used for login and authentication user interface elements.
member.remarks: Use this record to provide custom or localized text for login forms, registration prompts, and related authentication UI components. Predefined instances such as and are available for common scenarios, or you can create custom instances for additional languages or branding requirements.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AccountLabels.Default
member.summary: Gets the default set of labels for login-related user interface elements.
member.remarks: Use this property to access a standard set of login labels when no customization is required. The returned instance is read-only and shared across the application.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AccountLabels.French
member.summary: Gets the set of login-related labels localized in French.
member.remarks: Use this property to access French translations for common authentication UI elements, such as login, registration, and password fields. This is useful for applications that support multiple languages and need to display user interface text in French.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProvider.OnFirstAfterRenderAsync
member.summary: Handles the initial post-render processing for an external authentication provider, updating the UI and navigation state based on the outcome of the external provider event.
member.remarks: This method should be called after the component's first render to process the result of an external authentication attempt. Depending on the outcome, it may navigate to a return URL, update the view to prompt for registration, or display account lockout information.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker
member.summary: Represents a Blazor component that displays and manages external authentication provider options for user sign-in or sign-up.
member.remarks: Use this component to present external login buttons (such as Google or Facebook) within a login or registration form. The component supports customization of provider icons, button text, and UI labels, and integrates with navigation and authentication services to initiate external authentication flows. It is typically used in scenarios where users can authenticate using third-party providers.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.s_culture
member.summary: Provides a culture-independent, invariant culture for formatting and parsing operations.
member.remarks: Use this field when culture-specific formatting is not required, ensuring consistent results regardless of the user's locale.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker._providers
member.summary: Represents the collection of external authentication providers available for user sign-in.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker._renderTextContent
member.summary: Represents a render fragment that generates the text content for each external authentication provider button.

member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that retrieves an instance for a given external icon name.
member.remarks: The delegate should accept a string representing the external icon name and return the corresponding . If no icon is found, the delegate may return null. This property allows customization of icon sourcing from external providers or resources.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the text associated with each external authentication provider.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.Labels
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of labels used for the login form UI elements.
member.remarks: Use this property to customize the text displayed for fields, buttons, and messages in the login form. If not set, default labels are used. This property is typically set via component parameters in Blazor applications.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component is being used for sign-in (false) or sign-up (true).

member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when an external authentication provider is selected.

member.summary: Gets or sets the service used to interact with external providers.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current login state for the user session.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.OnProviderSelectedAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Navigates to the external login page for the specified authentication provider.
member.remarks: This method initiates a navigation to the external login flow, typically used to authenticate users via third-party providers such as Google or Facebook. The navigation is performed with a full page reload to ensure the external authentication process starts correctly.
member.param: The name of the external authentication provider to use for login. Cannot be null or empty.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.GetIconFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an icon associated with the specified provider name using an external icon provider, if available.
member.remarks: If no external icon provider is set or the provider does not supply an icon for the given name, the method returns .
member.param: The name of the provider for which to retrieve the icon. Cannot be null.
member.returns: An instance representing the icon for the specified provider if found; otherwise, .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ExternalProviderPicker.GetTextContent(System.String)
member.summary: Generates the localized text content for a provider button based on the current sign-up or connect state.
member.remarks: The returned text varies depending on whether the control is in sign-up mode or connect mode. The format and language are determined by the current culture and resource labels.
member.param: The display name of the authentication provider to include in the generated text. Cannot be null.
member.returns: A localized string containing the appropriate button text for the specified provider. Returns null if the provider name is null.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ExternalProviderPicker class with a unique identifier.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword
member.summary: Represents a view component that provides the user interface and logic for the 'Forgot Password' workflow in a login form.
member.remarks: Use this component to display and manage the password recovery process within an authentication UI. The component exposes parameters to customize labels and handle login or sign-up actions. It is typically used as part of a larger authentication or account management system.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword._model
member.summary: Represents the data model for the forgot password form, including the email address field.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword._fluentEditForm
member.summary: Represents the FluentEditForm instance used for form validation and submission.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword._errorMessage
member.summary: Represents an error message to be displayed in the forgot password view.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword._isProcessing
member.summary: Represents whether the component is currently processing an operation, such as sending instructions.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.OnSendInstructions
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when instructions to send a password are triggered.
member.remarks: Use this event to handle custom logic when password sending instructions need to be processed, such as sending an email or displaying a notification. The event provides details about the send operation through the parameter.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.OnInstructionsSent
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when instructions have been sent.
member.remarks: Use this event to execute custom logic after the instructions are successfully sent. The callback is triggered in response to the relevant user action or process completion.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.AriaDisabled
member.summary: Gets the value for the 'aria-disabled' attribute based on the current processing state.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent component in the cascading parameter hierarchy.
member.remarks: This property is set automatically by the Blazor framework when the component is used within a context. It should not be set manually.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.IsDisabled
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current operation is disabled due to ongoing processing or validation errors.
member.remarks: The property returns if either a process is currently active or if there are validation messages present in the associated edit form. This can be used to control UI elements such as disabling buttons or inputs when user interaction should be prevented.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.OnLoginAsync
member.summary: Invokes the login event asynchronously if it is not already being processed.
member.remarks: If a login operation is already in progress, this method returns immediately without invoking the login event.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.OnSignUpAsync
member.summary: Handles the sign-up action asynchronously by invoking the associated sign-up event if it is assigned.
member.remarks: If a sign-up operation is already in progress, this method returns immediately without invoking the event. This method should be awaited to ensure that the sign-up process completes before proceeding.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ForgotPassword.OnSendInstructionsAsync
member.summary: Handles the process of sending password reset instructions asynchronously based on the current model state and event handlers.
member.remarks: This method checks for the presence of required event handlers and a valid email address before attempting to send instructions. Depending on the outcome, it invokes additional event handlers to signal success or specific failure reasons. This method is typically used within a component to coordinate password reset workflows.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

The password and confirmation password must match to validate the registration request.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText
member.summary: Represents a configurable text component for displaying descriptive content within a login overlay, allowing customization of text, color, font, and layout styles.
member.remarks: Use this component to present descriptive or explanatory text in a slideshow interface. The appearance of the text can be customized using standard CSS style values for color, font family, font size, font weight, letter spacing, line height, and margin. All style-related properties accept valid CSS values as strings. If a property is not set, a default value is applied as specified in each property's documentation.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display in the description area of the slideshow.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS color value to apply to the component's content.
member.remarks: If not set, the default color is "white". Accepts any valid CSS color string, such as a named color (e.g., "red"), a hex code (e.g., "#FF0000"), or an RGB/RGBA value.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS font family to apply to the component's text.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS font size to apply to the component's content.
member.remarks: The value should be a valid CSS font-size string, such as "16px", "1.5em", or "large". If not set, the default value is "24px".

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight to apply to the text content.
member.remarks: Accepts standard CSS font-weight values, such as numeric values (e.g., "400", "700") or keywords (e.g., "normal", "bold"). The default value is "400".

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.LetterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS letter-spacing value to apply to the element's text content.

members.member: Gets or sets the line height value for the element. *

member.summary: Gets or sets the margin value to apply, typically used to define spacing around an element.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoginOverlayText.InternalStyle
member.summary: Gets the computed CSS style string based on the current style-related property values.
member.remarks: This property combines individual style settings, such as color, font, and spacing, into a single CSS style string. It is intended for internal use when rendering elements with dynamic styles.

member.remarks: Use this property to handle reset password actions initiated by the user. The callback receives a instance containing details about the reset request. Assign a delegate to perform custom logic, such as validating input or updating user credentials, when the event is triggered.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ResetPassword.OnResetPasswordAsync
member.summary: Handles the asynchronous reset password operation, raising the appropriate events based on the outcome.
member.remarks: This method clears any existing errors, initiates the reset password process, and updates the processing state. It raises the reset password event and, depending on the result, either updates the error collection or signals a successful reset. This method is typically invoked in response to a user action, such as submitting a reset password form.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ResetPasswordConfirmation
member.summary: Represents the confirmation view displayed after a user successfully resets their password.
member.remarks: This component is typically used in authentication workflows to inform users that their password reset was successful. It can be customized via parameters to adjust labels and handle login actions. The component is intended for use within login or account management pages.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ResetPasswordConfirmation.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback for when the user clicks the login button.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxLottiePlayer
member.summary: Represents a customizable player component for rendering and controlling animations.
member.remarks: The component allows developers to render animations using a specified renderer and provides options to control playback behavior, such as looping, autoplay, and playback speed. The component also supports customizable dimensions and accepts a path to the animation file.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LottieOptions
member.summary: Represents configuration options for a Lottie animation.
member.remarks: This record is used to configure the behavior and rendering of a Lottie animation. It includes options for the animation's file path, playback settings, speed, and rendering type.
member.param: The file path to the Lottie animation. This must be a valid path to the animation file.
A value indicating whether the animation should loop continuously. The default value is .
A value indicating whether the animation should start playing automatically. The default value is .
The playback speed of the animation. A value of 1 represents normal speed. Values greater than 1 increase the speed, while values between 0 and 1 decrease it. The default value is 1.
The rendering type for the animation. This determines how the animation is rendered (e.g., as SVG or Canvas). The default value is .

member.remarks: This class serves as a base for implementing functionality related to observing and reacting to changes in Fluent components. It is sealed and cannot be inherited.

member.summary: Indicates whether the object has been rendered.
member.remarks: This field is used to track the rendering state of the object. It is intended for internal use and should not be accessed directly.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider._pendingItems
member.summary: A thread-safe queue used to store pending observer items for processing.
member.remarks: This queue ensures safe concurrent access and is used to manage items that are awaiting processing in a multi-threaded environment.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider._pendingGroups
member.summary: A thread-safe queue that holds pending group observer items to be processed.
member.remarks: This queue is used to manage and store items of type that are awaiting processing. The use of ensures thread-safe operations for adding and removing items in a concurrent environment.

member.summary: Represents a reference to a JavaScript module that is used for interop operations.

member.summary: Gets or sets the debounce interval for resize events.

member.summary: Gets or sets the debounce duration for handling intersection events.
