member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript runtime abstraction used to invoke JavaScript functions from .NET.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.NotifyAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GroupObserverItem)
member.summary: Notifies the system of changes to the specified group by registering intersection and resize observers for each item in the group.
member.remarks: This method performs no action if the component has not been rendered. For each item in the group, intersection and resize observers are registered to monitor changes related to the item's associated element.
member.param: The group containing the items to be observed. Each item must have a valid identifier and associated element.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.NotifyAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem)
member.summary: Notifies the system to register intersection and resize observers for the specified item.
member.remarks: This method registers intersection and resize observers for the provided item if the system is in a rendered state. The must have a non-null identifier and element for the operation to succeed.
member.param: The containing the identifier and element to be observed.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.UnnotifyGroupAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously removes notifications for all items in the specified group.
member.remarks: This method unregisters intersection and resize notifications for each item in the group. It has no effect if the group does not exist or if the component has not been rendered.
member.param: The unique identifier of the group whose notifications are to be removed. Cannot be or empty.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.UnnotifyItemAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes notifications for the specified item, including intersection and resize event tracking, if the component is rendered.
member.param: The unique identifier of the item to unnotify. Cannot be or empty.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.OnIntersectBatchAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IntersectBatch)
member.summary: Processes a batch of intersection events and notifies registered observers for each intersected element.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be invoked from JavaScript via interop. Each entry in the batch is dispatched to the corresponding observer if it is registered. No notification occurs for elements without a registered observer.
member.param: The batch of intersection entries to process. Must not be null.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation of notifying observers for each intersection entry.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.OnMutationBatchAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationBatch)
member.summary: Processes a batch of DOM mutation events received from JavaScript and dispatches them to registered observers asynchronously.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be invoked from JavaScript via interop. Each mutation entry in the batch is delivered to the corresponding observer based on its group and identifier. If no observer is registered for a given entry, that entry is ignored.
member.param: The batch of mutation events to process. Must not be null. Contains the collection of mutation entries and the associated group identifier.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation of dispatching mutation events to observers.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider.OnResizeBatchAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ResizeBatch)
member.summary: Processes a batch of resize events and asynchronously notifies observers for each affected element.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be invoked from JavaScript via interop. Observers are notified only for elements that are currently registered in the specified group.
member.param: The batch of resize event data containing the group identifier and a collection of entries representing elements that have been resized.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation of notifying observers for each resize event.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GroupObserverItem
member.summary: Represents an item within a group observer, typically used to monitor or manage changes in a grouped collection of components.
member.remarks: This class is intended to be used as part of a group observation mechanism, where it serves as an individual item within the group. It inherits from , which provides base functionality for fluent component design.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The constructor generates a new unique identifier for the instance using .

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IIntersectObserver
member.summary: Defines methods for registering and unregistering elements for intersection observation.
member.remarks: This interface is typically used to monitor the visibility or intersection of elements within a viewport or container. It supports grouping elements for more granular control over intersection observation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IIntersectObserver.RegisterIntersectAsync(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference)
member.summary: Registers an intersection observer for the specified element within a group.
member.param: The unique identifier of the group to which the element belongs.
The unique identifier of the element to observe.
A reference to the DOM element to be observed.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IIntersectObserver.UnregisterIntersectAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously unregisters an intersecting element from a specified group.
member.remarks: This method removes the specified element from the group, ensuring it is no longer considered part of the intersection. If the element or group does not exist, the method completes without making changes.
member.param: The unique identifier of the group from which the element will be unregistered. Cannot be null or empty.
The unique identifier of the element to be unregistered. Cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IMutationObserver
member.summary: Defines an interface for observing and managing DOM mutations on specified elements within a group context.
member.remarks: Implementations of this interface allow clients to register and unregister mutation observers for elements, typically to react to changes in the DOM such as attribute modifications, child list updates, or subtree changes. This is commonly used in scenarios where dynamic UI updates or synchronization with client-side state are required. Thread safety and observer lifecycle management depend on the specific implementation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IMutationObserver.RegisterMutationAsync(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions)
member.summary: Registers a mutation observer for the specified DOM element, enabling asynchronous tracking of changes according to the provided options.
member.remarks: If an observer is already registered for the specified element and group, this method may overwrite the previous registration. This method does not begin observing until registration is complete.
member.param: The identifier for the observer group. Used to associate the mutation observer with a logical group for management or disposal.
The unique identifier of the DOM element to observe for mutations.
A reference to the DOM element that will be observed for mutations. Must not be null.
The configuration options that specify which types of mutations to observe, such as attribute changes, child list modifications, or subtree changes. Cannot be null.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous registration operation. The task completes when the mutation observer has been successfully registered.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IMutationObserver.UnregisterMutationAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously unregisters a mutation identified by the specified group and element IDs.
member.param: The unique identifier of the mutation group containing the mutation to unregister. Cannot be null or empty.
The unique identifier of the mutation element to unregister within the specified group. Cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous unregister operation.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IResizeObserver
member.summary: Defines methods for observing and managing resize events for DOM elements.
member.remarks: This interface provides functionality to register and unregister DOM elements for resize observation. It supports grouping elements by an optional group identifier, allowing for more granular control over resize event handling. Use this interface to monitor size changes of specific elements in a web application.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.IResizeObserver.RegisterResizeAsync(System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.ElementReference)
member.summary: Registers an element for resize event tracking within a specified group.
member.remarks: This method enables resize event tracking for the specified element, allowing the application to respond to changes in the element's size. Ensure that the and are unique within the context of the application.
member.param: The identifier of the group to which the element belongs. This value cannot be null or empty.
The unique identifier of the element to be tracked. This value cannot be null or empty.
A reference to the DOM element to be monitored for resize events.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Unregisters a resize listener for a specific element within a group asynchronously.
member.param: The identifier of the group containing the element. Cannot be or empty.
The identifier of the element to unregister. Cannot be or empty.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry
member.summary: Represents a record of a single mutation event, including details about the type of mutation and affected nodes or attributes.
member.remarks: Use this type to capture and convey information about changes to a document structure, such as attribute modifications or node additions and removals. The properties provide context for the mutation, including the mutation type, affected attribute name, previous value, and serialized representations of added or removed nodes. This record is typically used in scenarios involving DOM change tracking or synchronization.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this instance.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of mutation to observe or process.
member.remarks: Valid values include "attributes", "childList", and "subtree". The meaning of each value depends on the context in which the property is used. This property is immutable after initialization.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.AttributeName
member.summary: Gets the name of the attribute associated with this instance.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.OldValue
member.summary: Gets the previous value before the most recent change, or null if no prior value exists.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.AddedNodes
member.summary: Gets the serialized representation of the nodes that were added.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationEntry.RemovedNodes
member.summary: Gets the serialized representation of nodes that have been removed.

member.remarks: Use this record to access details about a mutation event, such as the type of mutation, affected attributes, and lists of added or removed nodes. All properties are immutable after initialization, ensuring event data remains consistent throughout its lifecycle.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions
member.summary: Represents configuration options for observing mutations in a DOM tree using a mutation observer.
member.remarks: Use this record to specify which types of DOM changes should be monitored, such as attribute modifications, changes to child elements, or updates to character data. Each property corresponds to a specific aspect of mutation observation and can be set to enable or disable monitoring of that aspect. These options are typically used when initializing a mutation observer to control its behavior.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.Attributes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether attributes are enabled.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.ChildList
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether child elements are included in the list.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.Subtree
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether operations should include the entire subtree of elements.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.AttributeOldValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the original value of an attribute is included during change tracking operations.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.CharacterData
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether character data is included in the output.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationObserverOptions.CharacterDataOldValue
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the old value of character data is included in mutation records.
member.remarks: When set to , mutation records will contain the previous value of the character data before the change occurred. This can be useful for tracking changes or implementing undo functionality. When , the old value is omitted from mutation records, which may improve performance if the previous value is not needed.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationType
member.summary: Specifies the type of change detected in a DOM mutation event, such as attribute modifications, changes to child nodes, or updates to textual content.
member.remarks: Use this enumeration to determine the nature of a DOM mutation when handling mutation events. Each value corresponds to a distinct category of change: attribute updates, additions or removals of child nodes, or modifications to character data. This can be useful for filtering or responding to specific mutation types in event handlers.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationType.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the collection of attributes associated with the current object.
member.remarks: Use this property to access metadata or custom information attached to the object, such as data annotations or user-defined attributes. The returned collection may be empty if no attributes are present.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationType.ChildList
member.summary: Represents a collection of child elements associated with a parent object.
member.remarks: Use this collection to access, enumerate, or manage child elements in hierarchical data structures. The order and mutability of the collection may depend on the specific implementation.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.MutationType.CharacterData
member.summary: Represents the textual data contained within a character node, such as text, CDATA, or comments, in a document object model (DOM).
member.remarks: Use this type to access or manipulate the character data of nodes that store text content. It is commonly used when working with XML or HTML documents to retrieve or modify the value of text nodes, CDATA sections, or comment nodes. This type does not represent element nodes or attributes.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem
member.summary: Represents an observer item which can be used within a to monitor or manage changes in a grouped collection of components.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the state of the observer, which is used to manage and track the observer's behavior and data.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.OnResize
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when the component is resized.
member.remarks: Use this property to handle resize events and respond to changes in the component's dimensions. The callback is triggered whenever a resize event occurs, providing information such as the new size.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.OnIntersect
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback to be invoked when an intersection event occurs.
member.remarks: The callback is triggered with an instance containing details about the intersection event. Use this property to handle intersection events, such as when an element enters or exits the viewport.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.OnMutation
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when a mutation event occurs within the component.
member.remarks: Assign a delegate to handle mutation events, such as changes to the component's data or state. The event provides details through the parameter. This callback is typically used to respond to or process mutations initiated by user actions or other triggers.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.ObserveResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component observes changes to its size and responds to resize events.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.MutationOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the options used to configure the behavior of the mutation observer for this component.
member.remarks: Specify mutation observer options to control which DOM changes are monitored, such as attribute modifications, child list changes, or subtree updates. If not set, default observation behavior will be used.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.ObserveIntersection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether intersection observation is enabled for the component.
member.remarks: When enabled, the component will monitor its visibility or intersection with a parent container, which can be used to trigger actions such as lazy loading or animations. This property is typically used in scenarios where you need to respond to changes in the component's visibility within the viewport.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem.ObserveMutation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether changes to the component's content should be observed for mutations.
member.remarks: When set to , the component will monitor its content for dynamic changes, such as additions or removals of child elements. This can be useful for scenarios where the content is updated outside of the normal rendering cycle.

member.summary: Represents a queue of items pending addition notifications when the provider is not available.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverState.AddGroupAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GroupObserverItem)
member.summary: Adds a group to the collection and notifies the provider if available.
member.remarks: If the provider is not available, the group is added to a pending queue for later processing. Otherwise, the provider is immediately notified of the added group.
member.param: The group to add. The group's must not be null, empty, or whitespace.
member.exception: Thrown if has a that is null, empty, or consists only of whitespace.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverState.RemoveGroupAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified group from the collection and updates its notification status.
member.remarks: If the provider is not available, the group is added to a queue of pending removals. Otherwise, the group is unnotified immediately.
member.param: The unique identifier of the group to remove. Cannot be null, empty, or consist only of whitespace.
member.exception: Thrown if is null, empty, or consists only of whitespace.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverState.AddItemAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem)
member.summary: Adds an item to the collection and notifies the provider if available.
member.remarks: If the provider is not available, the item is added to a pending queue to be processed later. Otherwise, the provider is notified immediately after the item is added.
member.param: The to add. The item's must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverState.RemoveItemAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverItem)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the collection and updates its notification state.
member.remarks: If a notification provider is available, the item's notification state is updated by calling the provider. Otherwise, the item's ID is added to a queue for pending removal.
member.param: The item to remove. The item's must not be null or empty.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObserverState.SetProviderAsync(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxObserverProvider)
member.summary: Sets the provider responsible for handling notifications and processes any pending notification actions.
member.remarks: When a new provider is set, any pending groups or items queued for notification are processed and sent to the provider. If the provider is set to , all pending notifications are discarded.
member.param: The instance to set as the current provider. If is , all pending notifications are cleared.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoadingBehavior
member.summary: Represents the loading behavior options for a picture component.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoadingBehavior.Auto
member.summary: Represents an automatic mode, typically allowing the browser to decide the best loading strategy based on context.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoadingBehavior.Lazy
member.summary: Represents a lazy loading strategy, where the image is loaded only when it is about to enter the viewport.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.LoadingBehavior.Eager
member.summary: Represents an eager loading strategy, where the image is loaded immediately, regardless of its position in the viewport.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit
member.summary: Represents the object fit options for a picture component.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit.None
member.summary: The default value, which means no specific object fit behavior is applied.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit.Fill
member.summary: Fills the entire container, potentially cropping the image if its aspect ratio differs from that of the container.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit.Cover
member.summary: Covers the entire container while maintaining the image's aspect ratio. This may result in some parts of the image being cropped.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit.Contain
member.summary: Contains the image within the container while maintaining its aspect ratio. This may result in empty space (letterboxing) if the aspect ratios differ.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ObjectFit.ScaleDown
member.summary: Reduces the size or scale of the object by a specified factor.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat
member.summary: Represents the different image formats that can be used when exporting a signature from the Signature component.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Bmp
member.summary: Represents the BMP (Bitmap) image format.
member.remarks: The BMP format is a widely used raster graphics image file format that stores bitmap digital images. It supports various color depths and compression methods.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Png
member.summary: Represents the Portable Network Graphics (PNG) image format.
member.remarks: PNG is a raster-graphics file format that supports lossless data compression. It is commonly used for web graphics and supports transparency.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Jpeg
member.summary: Represents a JPEG image format.
member.remarks: This class or enumeration is used to identify or work with JPEG image files, which are commonly used for storing and transmitting photographic images.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Webp
member.summary: Represents the WebP image format.
member.remarks: WebP is a modern image format that provides superior lossless and lossy compression for images on the web. It is designed to reduce image file sizes while maintaining high visual quality.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Gif
member.summary: Represents an animated image in the Graphics Interchange Format (GIF).
member.remarks: This class provides functionality for working with GIF images, including accessing frames, metadata, and playback properties. It can be used to load, manipulate, and display GIF animations.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Svg
member.summary: Represents an SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) element, which is a vector-based image format for defining graphics using XML.
member.remarks: This class provides functionality for working with SVG elements, including creating, manipulating, and rendering SVG content. SVG is widely used for scalable and resolution-independent graphics in web and application development.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureImageFormat.Pdf
member.summary: Represents a PDF (Portable Document Format) document, which is a file format used to present and exchange.
member.remarks: PDF documents are widely used for sharing and printing documents while preserving their formatting.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnExportClickedAsync
member.summary: Displays the export settings panel to the user and allows them to configure and confirm export options.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously opens a dialog panel for exporting signatures. The panel includes options for configuring export settings, as well as primary and secondary actions for confirming or canceling the operation. The dialog is aligned to the right side of the screen.
member.returns: Returns a task which displays the export settings panel when completed.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnPenSettingsClickedAsync
member.summary: Displays the pen settings panel to the user and allows them to configure and confirm pen options.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously opens a dialog panel for configuring pen options, as well as primary and secondary actions for confirming or canceling the operation. The dialog is aligned to the right side of the screen.
member.returns: Returns a task which displays the pen settings panel when completed.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnEraserSettingsClickedAsync
member.summary: Displays the eraser settings panel to the user and allows them to configure and confirm eraser options.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously opens a dialog panel for configuring eraser options, as well as primary and secondary actions for confirming or canceling the operation. The dialog is aligned to the right side of the screen.
member.returns: Returns a task which displays the pen settings panel when completed.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnGridSettingsClickedAsync
member.summary: Displays the grid settings panel to the user and allows them to configure and confirm grid options.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously opens a dialog panel for configuring grid options, as well as primary and secondary actions for confirming or canceling the operation. The dialog is aligned to the right side of the screen.
member.returns: Returns a task which displays the grid settings panel when completed.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnWatermarkSettingsClickedAsync
member.summary: Displays the watermark settings panel to the user and allows them to configure and confirm watermark options.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously opens a dialog panel for configuring watermark options, as well as primary and secondary actions for confirming or canceling the operation. The dialog is aligned to the right side of the screen.
member.returns: Returns a task which displays the watermark settings panel when completed.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnUndoClickedAsync
member.summary: Reverts the most recent action performed on the signature, if available.
member.remarks: This method performs an undo operation on the signature if a signature instance is present. If no signature is available, the method does nothing.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous undo operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnRedoClickedAsync
member.summary: Handles the redo action by invoking the redo operation on the associated signature, if available.
member.remarks: This method performs the redo operation asynchronously. If no signature is associated, the method does nothing.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnPenClickedAsync
member.summary: Handles the event triggered when the pen is clicked, ensuring the signature control exits erase mode.
member.remarks: This method sets the signature control to non-erase mode if the signature control is initialized.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnEraserClickedAsync
member.summary: Enables erase mode for the signature component asynchronously.
member.remarks: This method sets the signature component to erase mode, allowing the user to erase content. If the signature component is not initialized, the method does nothing.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.FluentCxSignature.OnClearClickedAsync
member.summary: Clears the signature if one is currently present.
member.remarks: This method asynchronously clears the signature data by invoking the method on the signature object. If no signature is present, the method does nothing.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display mode of the grid.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of each cell in the grid, in pixels.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the grid lines or dots.

member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the grid, ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.BoldEvery
member.summary: Gets or sets how often to bold the grid lines. For example, a value of 5 will bold every 5th line.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.StrokeWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the grid lines, in pixels.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.DashArray
member.summary: Gets or sets the dash array for the grid lines, allowing for dashed or dotted lines.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.ShowAxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the X and Y axes in the grid.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.BackgroundColor

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureGridOptions.PointRadius

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions
member.summary: Represents configuration options for applying a shadow effect.
member.remarks: This class provides properties to control the appearance of a shadow, including its visibility, color, blur radius, and offsets. These options can be used to customize the shadow effect for visual elements.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the shadow effect is enabled.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the shadow. This can be any valid CSS color value, such as a hex code, RGB, or RGBA.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.Blur
member.summary: Gets or sets the blur radius of the shadow. A higher value results in a more blurred shadow.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal offset of the shadow. Positive values move the shadow to the right, while negative values move it to the left.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical offset of the shadow. Positive values move the shadow down, while negative values move it up.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ShadowOptions.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties to their default values.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions
member.summary: Represents the eraser options for the signature component.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the eraser in pixels.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of the eraser. Can be either Circle or Square.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the eraser, ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.SoftEdges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the eraser should have soft edges.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor style when the eraser is active. This can be any valid CSS cursor value.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.CursorCss
member.summary: Gets the CSS representation of the cursor style.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.PartialErase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the eraser performs a partial erase.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureEraserOptions.Reset

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions
member.summary: Represents the configuration options for a signature component, including settings for the pen, eraser, grid, and watermark.
member.remarks: This class provides a collection of customizable options that control the behavior and appearance of a signature component. Use the properties to configure specific aspects such as the pen style, eraser functionality, grid layout, and watermark display.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions.Pen
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for configuring the pen used in the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions.Eraser
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for configuring the eraser used in the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions.Grid
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for configuring the grid displayed in the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions.Watermark
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for configuring the watermark displayed in the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureOptions.Export
member.summary: Gets or sets the options for configuring the export settings of the signature component.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions
member.summary: Represents the pen options for the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the pen. This can be any valid CSS color value, such as a hex code, RGB, or RGBA.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.BaseWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the base width of the pen stroke in pixels. This is the default width when pressure sensitivity is not applied.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.DashArray
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of the pen stroke in pixels. This is the thinnest the stroke can be when pressure sensitivity is applied.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.PressureEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pressure sensitivity is enabled. When true, the stroke width will vary based on the pressure applied (if supported by the input device).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.Smoothing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether smoothing is applied to the pen strokes. When true, the strokes will be smoothed to reduce jitter and create a more natural appearance.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the pen strokes, ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.LineCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of the ends of the pen strokes. Can be either Butt, Round, or Square.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.LineJoin
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of the corners where two pen strokes meet. Can be either Bevel, Round, or Miter.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadow options for the pen strokes.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignaturePenOptions.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties to their default values.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions
member.summary: Represents the watermark options for the signature component.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be displayed as the watermark. If both Text and ImageUrl are provided, the image will take precedence.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the image to be used as the watermark. If both Text and ImageUrl are provided, the image will take precedence.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the watermark, ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the font family for the watermark text. This can be any valid CSS font-family value.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size for the watermark text, in pixels.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight for the watermark text. This can be any valid CSS font-weight value, such as "normal", "bold", or a numeric value like "400" or "700".

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the watermark text. This can be any valid CSS color value, such as a hex code, RGB, or RGBA.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle of the watermark text or image, in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise, while negative values rotate counterclockwise.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the watermark within the signature area, represented as a Point with X and Y coordinates (in percentage). The default position is centered at (50, 50).

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the watermark should be repeated across the signature area. If true, the watermark will be tiled; if false, it will appear only once at the specified position.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.TextAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the watermark text. This can be "start", "middle", or "end".

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.LetterSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the letter spacing for the watermark text, in pixels.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureWatermarkOptions.Reset
member.summary: Resets all properties to their default values.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExporter
member.summary: Exports a signature in the specified format, returning the file name, content type, and binary data.
member.remarks:
The export format is determined by the property:
If the format is , the method returns the SVG data as-is.
If the format is , the SVG is converted to a PDF document.
For other image formats (e.g., PNG, JPEG), the SVG is converted to the specified format using the provided quality setting.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExporter.Export(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExportOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Exports a signature image in the specified format.
member.remarks: The method supports exporting the signature in various formats, including SVG, PDF, and common image formats such as PNG, JPEG, BMP, GIF, TIFF, and WebP. The content type and file extension are determined based on the selected format. For SVG format, the method directly returns the input SVG data. For PDF and other image formats, the method converts the SVG data using the appropriate conversion logic.
member.param: The export options, including the desired image format and quality settings.
The SVG representation of the signature to be exported. Cannot be null or empty.
member.returns: A tuple containing the filename, content type, and binary data of the exported signature image. The filename includes the appropriate file extension based on the selected format.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExportEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for an event that occurs when a signature is exported.
member.remarks: This class contains information about the exported signature, including the file name, content type, and binary data.
member.param: The name of the file to which the signature is exported. This value cannot be null or empty.
The MIME type of the exported signature file, such as "application/pdf" or "image/png".
The binary data of the exported signature. This value cannot be null.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExportEventArgs.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Provides data for an event that occurs when a signature is exported.
member.remarks: This class contains information about the exported signature, including the file name, content type, and binary data.

The MIME type of the exported signature file, such as "application/pdf" or "image/png".
The binary data of the exported signature. This value cannot be null.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SignatureExportEventArgs.Data

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width, in pixels, that the component can occupy.

member.summary: Gets the css classes to use.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaption.InternalStyle
member.summary: Gets the computed CSS style string for the component, including any maximum width constraints.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText
member.summary: Represents a configurable text component for displaying descriptive content within a slideshow, allowing customization of text, color, font, and layout styles.
member.remarks: Use this component to present descriptive or explanatory text in a slideshow interface. The appearance of the text can be customized using standard CSS style values for color, font family, font size, font weight, letter spacing, line height, and margin. All style-related properties accept valid CSS values as strings. If a property is not set, a default value is applied as specified in each property's documentation.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to display in the description area of the slideshow.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS color value to apply to the component's content.
member.remarks: If not set, the default color is "white". Accepts any valid CSS color string, such as a named color (e.g., "red"), a hex code (e.g., "#FF0000"), or an RGB/RGBA value.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS font family to apply to the component's text.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the CSS font size to apply to the component's content.
member.remarks: The value should be a valid CSS font-size string, such as "16px", "1.5em", or "large". If not set, the default value is "24px".

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.SlideshowCaptionText.FontWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the font weight to apply to the text content.
member.remarks: Accepts standard CSS font-weight values, such as numeric values (e.g., "400", "700") or keywords (e.g., "normal", "bold"). The default value is "400".

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Middleware.ImageProcessingMiddleware.InvokeAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Processes HTTP requests to handle image proxying, including resizing, reformatting, and caching.
member.remarks:
This middleware intercepts requests with the path starting with "/image-proxy" and processes them to retrieve, resize, and reformat images based on query parameters. The processed image is cached for subsequent requests to improve performance. If the path does not match, the request is passed to the next middleware in the pipeline. Query parameters:
url The URL of the image to be processed. This parameter is required.
format The desired image format (e.g., "jpeg", "png"). Defaults to "jpeg" if not specified.
quality The quality of the output image (1-100). Defaults to 80 if not specified or invalid.
width The desired width of the output image. If 0 or not specified, the original width is used.
height The desired height of the output image. If 0 or not specified, the original height is used. Responses:
200 OK The processed image is returned in the response body.
400 Bad Request Returned if the "url" query parameter is missing or invalid.
500 Internal Server Error Returned if an error occurs during image processing.
member.param: The representing the current HTTP request and response.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Middleware.ImageProcessingMiddleware.DownloadImageAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the image from the specified URL using the appropriate strategy.
member.param: Url of the image to download.
member.returns: Returns a task which downloads the url when completed.

member.summary: Resizes the specified image to the given dimensions while maintaining the aspect ratio if one dimension is set to zero.
member.param: The original image to resize. Cannot be .
The desired width of the resized image. If set to 0, the width is calculated to maintain the aspect ratio.
The desired height of the resized image. If set to 0, the height is calculated to maintain the aspect ratio.
member.returns: A new instance representing the resized image. If both and are 0, the original image is returned.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.Middleware.ImageProcessingMiddleware.EncodeImage(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap,System.String,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Encodes an image into a specified format with a given quality level.
member.remarks: This method supports a variety of image formats, including PNG, JPEG, WebP, AVIF, HEIF, GIF, BMP, WBMP, KTX, and ICO. If the specified format is not recognized, the image is encoded as JPEG.
member.param: The representing the image to encode.
The desired image format as a string (e.g., "png", "jpeg", "webp"). If the format is not recognized, the default format is JPEG.
The quality level of the encoded image, ranging from 0 to 100. Higher values indicate better quality.
When the method returns, contains the MIME type corresponding to the encoded image format. If the format is not recognized, the MIME type defaults to "image/jpeg".
member.returns: A byte array containing the encoded image data.

member.summary: Current state of the animation engine.

member.summary: Represents the currently registered animation groups.

member.summary: Represents the layout strategy used to arrange animated elements.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.jsonAnimatedElements
member.summary: A thread-safe queue that stores instances of .
member.remarks: This queue is used to manage objects in a concurrent environment, ensuring safe access and modification across multiple threads.

member.name: E:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.StateChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets the event that is triggered when the state of the animation engine changes.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the animation engine.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Register(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement)
member.summary: Registers an animated element for tracking and ensures it is added to the collection.
member.remarks: If the specified element is already registered, the method does nothing. Otherwise, the element is added to the internal collection, and a clone of the element is stored for future reference.
member.param: The animated element to register. Cannot be .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.RegisterGroup(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElementGroup)
member.summary: Registers an animation group and stores a snapshot of its animated elements.
member.remarks: This method adds the specified animation group to the internal collection of groups. Additionally, it creates and stores a snapshot of the current state of each animated element within the group, keyed by their unique identifier.
member.param: The animation group to register. Must not be .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.SetLayout(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ILayoutStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the layout strategy to be used for arranging items.
member.param: The layout strategy to apply. If , a default grid layout is used.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Unregister(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElement)
member.summary: Unregisters the specified animated element, removing it from the collection of tracked elements.
member.param: The animated element to unregister. Cannot be .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.UnregisterGroup(FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.AnimatedElementGroup)
member.summary: Unregisters the specified animation group, removing it and its associated animated elements from the internal collections.
member.remarks: This method removes the animation group from the internal collection of groups and also removes all animated elements associated with the group from the internal tracking collection.
member.param: The animation group to unregister. This parameter cannot be .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Update
member.summary: Updates the state of animated elements and returns a list of the updated elements.
member.remarks: This method processes both grouped and non-grouped animated elements, updating their state based on the current time.
member.returns: A list of objects representing the updated animated elements.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.UpdateGroupElements(System.DateTime,System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue{FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.JsonAnimatedElement})
member.summary: Updates the elements of all groups by applying the layout strategy and calculating the differences between the current and previous states.
member.remarks: This method processes all groups in parallel. For each group, it applies the layout strategy and computes the differences between the current state and the previous state. The calculated differences are added to the provided queue.
member.param: The current timestamp used to calculate differences in the group elements.
A thread-safe queue to which the method enqueues the calculated differences as objects.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.UpdateNoGroupElements(System.DateTime,System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue{FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.JsonAnimatedElement})
member.summary: Updates the state of elements that are not part of a group and enqueues their changes into the specified queue if any differences are detected.
member.remarks: This method applies the layout strategy to the elements, updates their state based on the current time, and calculates the differences between their current and previous states. If differences are found, the changes are serialized into a object and added to the queue.
member.param: The current timestamp used to update the elements.
A thread-safe queue to which the updated elements, represented as , are enqueued if changes are detected.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.ApplyStartTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Applies the specified start time to the layout strategy and all groups within the collection.
member.param: The start time to apply, typically representing the current date and time.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.SetMaxDisplayedItems(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of items to be displayed.
member.remarks: This method updates the internal limit on the number of items that can be displayed at once. Ensure that the value provided is within the acceptable range for your application.
member.param: The maximum number of items to display. Must be a non-negative integer.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.GetAll
member.summary: Returns a distinct list of all registered animated element IDs, including those within groups.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the animation engine, transitioning it to the paused state.
member.remarks: After calling this method, the animation engine will halt progression until resumed. This method has no effect if the engine is already paused.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Reset
member.summary: Resets the animation engine to its initial state and notifies listeners of the state change.
member.remarks: This method sets the engine state to NotStarted and raises the StateChanged event. Use this method to reinitialize the animation engine before starting a new animation sequence.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.OnCompleted
member.summary: Marks the animation engine as completed, updating its state accordingly.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the animation engine, transitioning it to the active state if it is currently paused or stopped.
member.remarks: This method has no effect if the engine is already running. Calling this method after a pause or stop allows animations to continue from their current position.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Stop
member.summary: Stops the animation engine and transitions its state to stopped.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Animations.AnimationEngine.Start
member.summary: Transitions the animation engine to the running state, allowing animations to begin or resume processing.

member.summary: Represents the various states of the animation engine.

member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine is paused.

member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine is running.

member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine has been stopped.

member.summary: Indicates that the animation engine has completed all animations.

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils
member.summary: Provides utility methods for working with colors, including conversions between color formats, validation of color values, and generation of color gradients and palettes.
member.remarks:
This class includes methods for validating and normalizing hexadecimal color codes, converting between RGB, HSL, and hexadecimal formats, and generating color gradients and palettes based on various strategies. It is designed to simplify common color manipulation tasks in applications that work with color data.
The methods in this class are static and thread-safe, making it suitable for use in multi-threaded environments.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.IsValidHex(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified string represents a valid hexadecimal color code.
member.remarks: A valid hexadecimal color code consists of either 3 or 6 hexadecimal digits, optionally prefixed with a '#' character. The method ignores leading and trailing whitespace.
member.param: The string to validate. This can optionally include a leading '#' character.
member.returns: if the string is a valid hexadecimal color code with 3 or 6 digits; otherwise, .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.IsValidHexOrCssName(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified string represents a valid hexadecimal color code or a recognized CSS color name.
member.remarks: A valid hexadecimal color code must start with a '#' character followed by 3 or 6 hexadecimal digits. Recognized CSS color names are determined by the CssColorNamesUtils utility.
member.param: The string to validate. This can be a hexadecimal color code (e.g., "#FFFFFF") or a CSS color name (e.g., "red").
member.returns: if the string is a valid hexadecimal color code or a recognized CSS color name; otherwise, .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.NormalizeToHex(System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a color value to its hexadecimal representation.
member.remarks: This method trims whitespace from the input and attempts to interpret it as a valid hexadecimal color code or a CSS color name. If the input is already a valid hexadecimal color code, it is normalized to the standard format. If the input is a recognized CSS color name, it is converted to its corresponding hexadecimal value.
member.param: The input color value, which can be a hexadecimal color code, a CSS color name, or a string to be normalized.
member.returns: A normalized hexadecimal color code in the format "#RRGGBB". If the input is null, empty, or invalid, the method returns "#000000".

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.NormalizeHex(System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a hexadecimal color code to a standard format.
member.remarks: If the input is in short form (e.g., "#123"), it will be expanded to long form (e.g., "#112233"). The method ensures the returned value always starts with a "#" and is in uppercase.
member.param: The hexadecimal color code to normalize. This can be in short form (e.g., "#123"), long form (e.g., "#112233"), or null/whitespace.
member.returns: A normalized hexadecimal color code in uppercase long form (e.g., "#112233"). Returns "#000000" if is null, empty, or consists only of whitespace.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.HexToRgb(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal color code to its RGB components.
member.remarks: The method normalizes the input hexadecimal string by removing the '#' character before parsing.
member.param: A string representing the hexadecimal color code. The string must start with a '#' character followed by six hexadecimal digits (e.g., "#FF5733").
member.returns: A tuple containing the red, green, and blue components of the color, each as an integer in the range 0 to 255.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.HexToRgbString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal color code to its RGB string representation.
member.param: The hexadecimal color code, starting with a '#' character, followed by 6 or 3 hexadecimal digits.
member.returns: A string representing the RGB values in the format "R,G,B", where R, G, and B are integers between 0 and 255.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.RgbToHex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts RGB color values to a hexadecimal color code.
member.param: The red component of the color, ranging from 0 to 255.
The green component of the color, ranging from 0 to 255.
The blue component of the color, ranging from 0 to 255.
member.returns: A string representing the hexadecimal color code, prefixed with '#'.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.HexToHsl(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal color code to its equivalent HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) representation.
member.remarks: The input hexadecimal color code must be in the format "#RRGGBB" or "#RRGGBBAA". If the alpha channel is included, it is ignored in the conversion.
member.param: The hexadecimal color code, starting with a '#' character, followed by 6 or 8 hexadecimal digits.
member.returns:
A tuple containing the HSL representation of the color:
H: The hue, in degrees, ranging from 0 to 360.
S: The saturation, as a percentage, ranging from 0 to 1.
L: The lightness, as a percentage, ranging from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.HslToHex(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a color from HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) format to its hexadecimal color representation.
member.remarks: The method internally converts the HSL values to RGB and then formats the RGB values as a hexadecimal string.
member.param: The hue of the color, specified as a value between 0 and 360 degrees.
The saturation of the color, specified as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
The lightness of the color, specified as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
member.returns: A string representing the color in hexadecimal format, prefixed with a '#' character.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.RgbToHsl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an RGB color value to its equivalent HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) representation.
member.remarks: The method normalizes the hue to ensure it is always within the range 0 to 360 degrees. Saturation and lightness values are clamped to the range 0 to 1.
member.param: The red component of the color, in the range 0 to 255.
The green component of the color, in the range 0 to 255.
The blue component of the color, in the range 0 to 255.
member.returns:
A tuple containing the HSL representation of the color:
H (Hue): The hue of the color, in degrees, in the range 0 to 360.
S (Saturation): The saturation of the color, in the range 0 to 1.
L (Lightness): The lightness of the color, in the range 0 to 1.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.HslToRgb(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a color from HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) color space to RGB (Red, Green, Blue) color space.
member.remarks: This method normalizes the hue value to ensure it falls within the valid range [0, 360] and clamps the saturation and lightness values to the range [0, 1]. The resulting RGB values are calculated based on the HSL-to-RGB conversion formula and are clamped to the range [0, 255].
member.param: The hue of the color, in degrees. Must be in the range [0, 360].
The saturation of the color, as a value between 0 and 1. Must be in the range [0, 1].
The lightness of the color, as a value between 0 and 1. Must be in the range [0, 1].
member.returns:
A tuple containing the RGB representation of the color:
R: The red component, as an integer in the range [0, 255].
G: The green component, as an integer in the range [0, 255].
B: The blue component, as an integer in the range [0, 255].

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.GenerateRandomHex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a list of unique random hexadecimal color codes.
member.remarks: The method ensures that all generated color codes are unique and case-insensitive. The format of each color code is a six-digit hexadecimal value prefixed with a hash symbol (#), representing RGB values.
member.param: The number of unique hexadecimal color codes to generate. Must be a non-negative integer.
member.returns: A list of strings, where each string is a unique hexadecimal color code in the format "#RRGGBB".

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.GenerateGradient(System.String,System.Int32,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GradientStrategy,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GenerationOptions)
member.summary: Generates a gradient of colors based on the specified base color, number of steps, and gradient strategy.
member.remarks:
The gradient generation strategy determines how the colors are interpolated:
: Adjusts the lightness of the base color to create darker or lighter shades.
: Adjusts both saturation and lightness to create tints of the base color.
: Adjusts the saturation of the base color while keeping lightness constant.
: Shifts the hue of the base color to create a range of colors around the color wheel. If the parameter specifies as , the resulting gradient will be reversed.
member.param: The base color in hexadecimal format (e.g., "#FF5733").
The number of colors to generate in the gradient. Must be greater than zero.
The strategy used to generate the gradient, such as shades, tints, saturation, or hue shift.
Optional configuration for gradient generation, including lightness, saturation, and reversal options. If null, default options are used.
member.returns: A list of hexadecimal color strings representing the generated gradient. The list will contain distinct colors, and its order may be reversed based on the specified options.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.GenerateCustomGradient(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GenerationOptions)
member.summary: Generates a gradient of colors between two specified hex color values.
member.remarks: The gradient is generated by interpolating the HSL (Hue, Saturation, Lightness) values of the start and end colors. The interpolation can be customized using the parameter.
member.param: The starting color of the gradient, represented as a hex string (e.g., "#FF0000").
The ending color of the gradient, represented as a hex string (e.g., "#0000FF").
The number of colors to generate in the gradient. Must be greater than zero.
Optional configuration for gradient generation, such as saturation and lightness constraints, and whether to reverse the gradient. If null, default options are used.
member.returns: A list of hex color strings representing the gradient. The list contains colors, starting with and ending with .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.GenerateScheme(System.String,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.ColorPaletteMode,System.Int32,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GenerationOptions)
member.summary: Generates a color scheme based on the specified base color, palette mode, and number of steps.
member.remarks:
The generated color scheme varies depending on the specified :
Complementary Generates a scheme with complementary colors split evenly across the specified steps.
Analogous Generates a scheme with colors adjacent to the base color on the color wheel.
Triadic Generates a scheme with three evenly spaced colors on the color wheel.
SplitComplementary Generates a scheme with colors split from the complementary color.
Monochrome Generates a scheme with shades of the base color.
Warm Generates a scheme with warm colors (e.g., reds and yellows).
Cool Generates a scheme with cool colors (e.g., blues and cyans).
Pastel Generates a scheme with soft, light colors.
Neon Generates a scheme with bright, vibrant colors.
Greyscale Generates a scheme with shades of grey.
AccessibilitySafe Generates a predefined scheme of colors optimized for accessibility. The method ensures that the returned list contains distinct colors, ignoring case.
member.param: The base color in hexadecimal format (e.g., "#FF5733").
The that determines the type of color scheme to generate.
The number of colors to include in the generated scheme. Must be greater than zero.
Optional configuration for color generation, such as gradient strategy or blending options. If null, default options are used.
member.returns: A list of hexadecimal color strings representing the generated color scheme. The list will contain distinct colors.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.InterpolateEasingValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Components.GenerationOptions)
member.summary: Calculates the interpolated value based on the current step, total steps, and easing options.
member.remarks: The method supports multiple easing functions, including exponential and sine-based easing. If is 1, the method returns 1.0 regardless of the easing function.
member.param: The current step index, where 0 represents the first step.
The total number of steps. Must be greater than 0.
The options specifying the easing function to apply.
member.returns: A double representing the interpolated value, adjusted according to the specified easing function.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.Lerp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values based on a weighting factor.
member.param: The starting value of the interpolation.
The ending value of the interpolation.
The interpolation factor, where 0.0 returns and 1.0 returns . Values outside the range [0.0, 1.0] will result in extrapolation.
member.returns: The interpolated value, calculated as a weighted average of and .

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.ShortestHueLerp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Interpolates between two hue values along the shortest path on the color wheel.
member.remarks: This method ensures that the interpolation follows the shortest path on the hue circle, accounting for the circular nature of hue values. The result is always normalized to the range [0, 360).
member.param: The starting hue, in degrees, where 0 < 360.
The ending hue, in degrees, where 0 < 360.
A value between 0.0 and 1.0 representing the interpolation factor. A value of 0.0 returns , and a value of 1.0 returns .
member.returns: The interpolated hue, in degrees, normalized to the range [0, 360).

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.Clamp01(System.Double)
member.summary: Clamps the specified value to the range [0.0, 1.0].
member.param: The value to clamp.
member.returns: The clamped value, which will be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.Clamp255(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clamps the specified integer value to the range of 0 to 255, inclusive.
member.param: The integer value to clamp.
member.returns: The clamped value, which will be 0 if is less than 0, 255 if is greater than 255, or itself if it is within the range.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Helpers.ColorUtils.NormalizeHue(System.Double)
member.summary: Normalizes a hue value to ensure it falls within the range of 0 to 360 degrees.
member.param: The hue value, in degrees, which may be any real number.
member.returns: The normalized hue value, in the range [0, 360).

member.name: T:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Security.EmailAddressRuleAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a property must contain a valid email address format.
member.remarks: Apply this attribute to a property to enforce email address validation when using data annotation-based validation frameworks. The validation checks that the property's value conforms to a standard email address pattern, but does not guarantee that the email address exists or is deliverable.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Blazor.Community.Security.EmailAddressRuleAttribute.emailPattern
member.summary: Represents the regular expression pattern used to validate email addresses according to RFC 5322 specifications.
member.remarks: This pattern supports most valid email address formats, including quoted strings and domain literals. It may not cover all edge cases defined by the RFC, but is suitable for general-purpose email validation in typical applications.

member.param: The password string to validate. Can be null or empty, in which case the method returns .
member.returns: A value indicating whether the password satisfies all required rules. Returns if the password is valid; otherwise, .

If the sum of minimum required character types exceeds the minimum length, an exception will be thrown during initialization.
